** <nowiki>[[http://www.thinkwiki.org/wiki/Category:390X|ThinkWiki 390X]]</nowiki>
=== Current Issues ===

* sound is choppy, slow and distorted
** solve by turning off "PCI Bus Power Management" in the BIOS (thanks to Mike in http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=7386)
*** F1 on boot to enter BIOS Setup Utility
      Config -> Advanced Setup -> PCI Bus Power Management: 
      change to "Disabled".
*** F10 for Save and Exit, sound now works normally!
** sometimes fixed by having certain PCMCIA network cards
 
=== Note ===

To watch DVDs specify more video memory in /etc/X11/xorg.conf, Section "Device"
<pre>
## # Sufficient memory for a full-screen DVD
   Option          "OverlayMem"    "829440"        
</pre>

=== Hardware details ===
There are various possible configurations I (FrancisBond running xubuntu edgy) have 
<pre>
IBM
2626J0U
Mobile Pentium II (400 MHz)
15" screen (1024x768) 
Multimedia audio controller: ESS Technology ES1969 Solo-1 Audiodrive (rev 02)
VGA compatible controller: Neomagic Corporation NM2200 [MagicGraph 256AV] (rev 20)
</pre>
